instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin Loop
threads.message:
Hi All,
Tis board came as liquid damaged but not much.  bit near clock chip/tiny bit on <RESISTOR>R5351</RESISTOR> near SMC and <RESISTOR>R1410</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> TP was gone but resister by itesl and the pads are fine.
Anyway I replaced the CLockchip and Y1905, <RESISTOR>R1410</RESISTOR>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> but no change.
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3v and all the power rails are present including <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> on the movement of fan spins. I reflow the SMC still same.
I change the bios with same board then fan goes continuously  but no chime no Display. also there is no USB mouse  continue light . 

Any advice will greatly appriciate.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin Loop
threads.message:
So board stays on, with all voltages after BIOS chip replaced?
That confirm BIOS corruption at least.
I recommend to test with known good BIOS file; clean ME, of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin Loop
threads.message:
Hi, thank yu for your reply. Sorry some how now for any bios it is same behavior. I tried with clean me and thr same bios I tried before but quarter fan spin loop
Could this be SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin Loop
threads.message: Replace SMC and see if symptom changes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin Loop
threads.message: Will do and update . thank you very much.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin Loop
threads.message: Hi Replaced SMC still same issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin Loop
threads.message:
Put back its BIOS chip.
If still stays on, but no activity, means heat affected board; wasn't BIOS issue.
Try to start in SMC bypass too.
